name: Pixel Dungeon
description: Pixel Dungeon is an exciting and extremely popular roguelike (more than 2 million mobile installs!). Explore the depths of Pixel Dungeon, collect useful items and fight fierce monsters to find the Amulet of Yendor - the ultimate artefact of this game world!
minimum_requirements: OS: XP / Vista / 7 / 8 Processor: 1.7+ GHz or better Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: OpenGL 3.0, 256Mb RAM Storage: 120 MB available space

reviews.review_text: I bought this only because I wanted to pay the author for the free Android version. It's a very basic port and still too goddam hard.
Best roguelite on mobile and desktop. Countless hours spent on the free Android version, bought the Steam version to support the developer.
I just can't get enough! I know about this game on my mobile phone, it's a little frustrated playing this game, but worth it. So I decided to buy this game on Steam to support the developers.

Of course, this game is wonderful. Still quite a challenge, however. You start off pretty weak, but as you go on, the gear you find gives you this little jolt as you continue to grow stronger. Haven't completed this game to this day, but highly reccomend it.
Amazing! I spent a lot of time on the mobile version, so i decided to waste more time on my PC!

I've never played the mobile version, but I'd imagine it works better as such. The keyboard controls are too fiddly. For example, it's near impossible to move only one square at a time unless you use the most ginger of key taps imaginable. This lack of fine control will often see you stepping on traps because you moved one space too many.  Otherwise PD is a pretty great game, however I feel the above gripe is enough to not reccommend it.
this game sucks a lot and its really bad dont play this gaem

Pixel Dungeon is very well made game. Now I realize that it is just a port of a free mobile game on Android, and in the past most ported games are not very good. But the port for this is very good, you can tell they worked very hard on it. Now I know your thinking 'Well why buy it here when i could just play it on my phone?' Because these p[eople deserve it. they are actual good devs. they care a tremendous amount about their game and the people playing it. now on to the fun stuff! -you will die a lot -you will rage a lot -you will cry maybe (probably(you baby)) -you will be on the brink of giving up -then you die and give up SIDENOTE: you probably shouldnt play if you any of the following types of people: 1. The Cry baby 2. The I got so mad I punched a hole through my monitor 3. The I hate rouge-likes(GTFO) or 4. The common console peasant (or filthy casual for that matter)

It is ok. The game itself is a lot of fun. I have it for the IPad and spend many hours on it, but I'm not as keen on the PC interface. The reason I got it for the PC was to be able to use my 360 controller on it, and I can't, not really. It reads the buttons, but not any of the sticks or pads, so you still end up using the mouse or keyboard to play.

I really luv this game, i played maybe 4 months on android and got this today which is WAY BETTER. although there is a glitch were my mouse randomly dissapears from my screen and i hav to restart the whole game evry tiem but i wont let that be a down side because this game is near perfect
